description: Early 15th century, in sense “sale of offices”, from Old French baraterie (“deceit, trickery”), from barat (“fraud, deceit, trickery”), of unknown origin, perhaps Celtic. In marine sense of “unlawful acts causing loss to owner”, 1620s..

entries.meaning: The act of persistently instigating lawsuits, often groundless ones.
examples: [Deacon Mushrat to Pogo:] The Machiavellian barratry of a pettifogging public has maundered into do-nothingism.

entries.meaning: The sale or purchase of religious or political positions of power.
(admiralty law) Unlawful or fraudulent acts by the crew of a vessel, harming the vessel's owner.
